creator: jan.bymark@capgemini.dk
text:
Hi,

I've installed apache 2.0.43 using httpd-2.0.43-sparc-sun-solaris2.8.tar.gz and when I 
try to start apache I get this error:

/usr/local/apache2/bin/apachectl start
ld.so.1: 
/usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd: fatal: libsendfile.so.1: open failed: No such file or 
directory
Killed

I've tried to add /usr/lib to my path (where ld.so.1 exists) but it didn't 
helped.

My server has installed patchlevel EIS 27-AUG-02 and the Solaris version is 
4/01

I've have tried to install apache 1.37 and that works fine.

Hope some one can help 
my

Jan Bymark

creator: slive@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 11769 ***

Hi,

I installed SUNWcsl but I still have the same problem:
#pkginfo |grep SUNWcsl
system      
SUNWcsl        Core Solaris, (Shared Libs)
system      SUNWcslx       Core Solaris Libraries (64-
bit)

#./apachectl start
ld.so.1: /usr/local/apache2/bin/httpd: fatal: 
libsendfile.so.1: open failed: No such file or directory
Killed

#more /etc/release
                        
Solaris 8 4/01 s28s_u4wos_08 SPARC
           Copyright 2001 Sun Microsystems, Inc.  All Rights 
Reserved.
                             Assembled 01 March 2001

I've tried to find libsendfile.so.1 but it's in my 
server. Is there any other packages I have to install???

I hope you can help me???

Jan
creator: jan.bymark@capgemini.dk
slive@apache.org
text:
Please do not reopen duplicate bugs unless they are not really duplicates.
If you have more information, it should be posted to bug 11769.

Regarding your particular problem, I believe you either need to build
apache yourself from source (recommended) or you need to upgrade the
entire OS to a later release that includes libsendfile.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 11769 ***
